meanings.sent1: She coughed acridly from the smoke in the air.
meanings.sent2: The burnt toast smelled acridly in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The acridly bitter medicine made her scrunch up her face.
meanings.sent4: His acridly sarcastic remarks left a bitter taste in everyone's mouth.
meanings.sent5: The acridly pungent odor of the chemicals lingered in the room.

meanings.definition: Having an acrid taste or smell
meanings.sent1: The acridly bitter coffee was undrinkable.
meanings.sent2: The acridly scent of vinegar filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The acridly flavored candy made her grimace in distaste.
meanings.sent4: The acridly sharp critique stung like vinegar on a wound.
meanings.sent5: The acridly sour taste of the lemon made her lips pucker.
